Key Arguments: The legislation undermines individuals' ability to discern truth from misinformation.
No government should have the authority to define truth, as this contradicts democratic principles.
The proposal is seen as a form of totalitarianism.
It is an attack on freedom of speech.
The legislation is described as unnecessary, invasive, and contrary to Australian values.
Notable Quotes: This is an insult to every person's intelligence to discern for themselves what is true information and what is misinformation.
No government has a monopoly of what is truth - isn't that the whole point of elections and democracy for the people to decide who they trust...
This proposed legislation is totalitarianism in disguise.
It is unnecessary, invasive and unaustralian.
